I was looking for Kim Ji Won's old works, and I saw 'To the beautiful you'. I thought I've definitely watched this drama in my early kdrama journey, how come I don't remember Jiwon here, then I started watching the clips, and one of them played this song, I didn't remember the title nor the singer but I naturally started singing it!
This song and this drama is close to my heart, I'll try to reminis for as long as possible💜

author: @Sanafield
text: Let us just clear up something, Koreans are big fan of rock not like you've stated. Unless a big idol had a comeback, the charts are always full with rock artists it's what the majority of people in Korea likes and certainly not K-pop. Idols are C-rated in Korea and the fans of K-pop are just teen girls.

author: @Sanafield
text: - maybe it was her choise and she likes it that way or else as you said she would've changed companies a long time ago. She debuted in 2007, so her contract must've ended awhile ago, I guess she wanted to stay and did. Regardless of how big S.M is, they had a lot of failing artists(talented ones) and ofc you wouldn't know about them because they failed.

author: @Sanafield
text: If that's the case, then I suggest half of S.M artists should move agencies. There are plenty of un-known artists under S.M who are really great but don't get to shine brightly. I don't know if it's wise for her to change companies because she'll just rotten somewhere if she did. I personally knew her through her Japanese singles and she's amazing. I don't think it's S.M's fault but it's the people's for not recognizing her talents.The reason to why she's only promoting in Japan is still unknown

author: @Kowanpoop
text: I've known J-min because of her Japanese songs, not her Korean ones so this isn't my first time hearing and knowing about her. She's debuted in 2007 but only has one Korean MV. Her latest Japanese song has been indefinitely postponed due to production costs. And yes, I've been sharing her music to my friends ever since I've heard of her.

text: This video is by SMTown. Obviously their work paid off for that you've noticed her greatness. I just discovered her a few days ago and I was sorry that I had missed out on her for a whole year. Now, we fans need to do some work to spread the words. I hope you are with me.

SM barely promotes her, she had her formal debut in Korea with this song, an OST song to a lackluster drama a few watched in Korea.

author: @Joaninhaa12
text:
Well, she promotes mainly in Japan. Someone who is not familiar with Japanese music might not know her. I'm pretty sure Korea enjoys rock, but kpop artists don't seem to be as popular as fans might think - so, someone from a label like SM Ent will probably be seen as a pretty face without much talent.
Also, SM doesn't seem to promote anything other than idol groups properly. I'm a SM stan and I'm forever amazed at how artists like J-Min and TRAX are underrated because they are not well promoted.

author: @TheAnamenia
text:
A high school girl will do anything to meet and get close to a boy she idolizes. Jae Hee is in love with Tae Joon, a pole-jumping gold medalist. She discovers that he attends high school at an all-boys’ school, so she cuts her hair and pretends to be a boy to be admitted to the school. But she soon learns that trying to blend in with the boys and keep her true identity a secret are no easy tasks.How long can she keep up the ruse, and will it all be worth the effort in the end?
This is the info:D

author: @Tsubasa9981
text: Wow idk who you are, but that's some attitude. People should respect your opinions, but you should respect that TBY was Hana Kimi in a KOREAN style. Most girls impersonating guys in Korean dramas, well, sound like girls, and not just in SM dramas (have you seen Your Beautiful?). I've read the manga, and I don't think there's anything wrong with redoing the same story line over and over if its timeless and popular. Just look at Romeo and Juliet, theres like a gazillion versions out there.

text:
1. I came here to listen to the song

author: @kylanishnik8757
text: A girl goes to an all-boys school (dressed up as a boy) to meet her inspiration, the famous gold medal winner, Kang Tae Joon. She ends up being his roommate and falls in love with him. She also has a very close friend who falls in love with her but still thinks she's a boy. Eun Gyeol (the friend) and Tae Joon do whatever they can to impress Jae Hee (the girl) and win over her heart. Tae Joon falls in love with her when he finds out she's a girl. He hates his dad and his mom dies

author: @TigerLovesRaccoon
text:
Woah! This song is awesome! :D 
And, I haven't seen the drama yet - but just from this I think they did well in choosing Minho and Sulli. Minho really has that whole athletic feel, and even though I had a different feel from the guy in the manga, Minho is really a good choice for the part! Sulli is really pretty and cute, and she can actually pass for a boy (this is a culture thing I think, none of my girl friends would be able to pull that off - they certainly wouldn't keep their feminity)

author: @MinuteOrMinute
text: It's from a K-drama called To the Beautiful You. Right now 12 episodes have been eng subbed (it's still being aired in Korea). :D It's about a girl who pretends to be a boy to get into an all-boys school. If you know about the Japanese manga Hana Kimi it's basically the same story. It's pretty good and it has some comedy to boot.

author: @manu135713
text:
Does anyone else think that some YouTubers don't get the exposure they deserve? I'm not talking about subscriptions - I'm saying that their videos don't even get a chance to get views because there are simply so many YouTubers now.

That being said, I'm a 17 year old Korean-American dude who sings, plays guitar and piano, vlogs, and films - all on my channel! I currently have about 1k subs but that's not the point. I would just like a chance to get seen. Thanks in advance if you take a look!
